intro: Blepharis refracta, commonly known as the refracta grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often pale blue or purple and bloom during the summer months. Blepharis refracta is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland dune habitats.
